intro: Polygala minima, commonly known as the lesser milkvetch, is a small, herbaceous perennial plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It typically grows to a height of about 10–30 centimeters and features delicate, usually pink or white flowers arranged in clusters. The plant has slender, branched stems and small, pinnate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands, rocky areas, and along roadsides. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
